Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: hewsier_girl
Reviews.Content: Great rooms & reasonable prices, especially on the weekend stays. Dave was extremely helpful & courteous! I'll be definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Wild about The Wild Wild West!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy D
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the Days Inn Las Vegas at the Wild Wild West and loved it. It is kind of a hike to the strip, so if walking is not your thing, best to rent a car or cab it. The staff (especially Bobby) was incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was clean upon arrival and cleaned daily. Would highly suggest to the higher ups at Palace Stations (the owner of the casino) that they invest in a shuttle for their guests, even if it's only between Palace owned casinos/hotels. That would have made our stay very close to perfect. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place and Nice People”
Reviews.Author: Alofa T
Reviews.Content: I really liked the stay.. Me and my family really enjoyed ourselves..I so recommend this place to anybody thats traveling into Vegas.. But I recommend the non smoking rooms cause they r much cleaner looking then the smoking rooms.. Not only did we enjoyed it .. We luved the fact that it was really close by the strip... Man,was it a walk.. But like i said we really loved it.. Thank you sooo much for everything housekeeping was on deck and Front desk people were awesome.. Thank you for making my wedding weekend FUN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Wild Wild West!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bearsdodgers
Reviews.Content: stay here on 3/23-3/26. We loved this place my wife and i have been to vegas many times and we learn early on that in vegas all you need a bed to sleep on! staying on the strip is nice we did that a couple of times, but the price was always crazy. So i found a great deal for Wild Wild West on bookit for 3day $130!!!!! How can you top that!!! plus free breakfast and coffee at Dennys come on!!! the location is great! it's very close to nyny maybe a 10min walk tops. The room 840 was great huge bed very clean overall. Staff was very nice when we needed them.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap place to stay in Las Vegas near Strip”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: The staff, Bobby in particular was great. The location is excellent with only a short walk to the strip and right by the airport. And the price is unbeatable. The rooms are clean....in short nothing wrong and a whole lot of good.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoRod
Reviews.Content: This is the best bang for the buck in Vegas. No one can beat the price, especially with the free daily breakfast. Front desk Rachel and Bobby are the best!

Reviews.Title: “NASCAR”
Reviews.Author: Claude B
Reviews.Content: Old hotel not recently updated. It was clean and comfortable. Stairs to second floor are to narrow to pack two suitcases. Hotel staff did not respond to calls to desk. Amenity charge but no fridge, no microwave. Free breakfast at Dennys is good but service is sometimes slow. (no reflection on hotel just letting you know). We had two rooms and they did try to put us close together, but I would have thought they would be adjoining. Price was average for when we booked. Easy access from the freeway and the strip. There are nicer hotels in Vegas for the money, I probably wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my visit”
Reviews.Author: LAEDEJ
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury, you have the wrong place, but if you are looking for a nice, clean, comfortable place then you found the place. I was pleasantly pleased to find what I did. The staff is wonderful and you get your breakfast and coffee free for the small you pay for the room. I was pleases with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: the1caligirl
Reviews.Content: I have been here a few times and highly recommend a stay. The Hospitality is wonderful and very courteous. Front desk clerk Bobby is awesome, will even sing to you. LOL The property is beautiful and immaculate rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: dvmkathymurf
Reviews.Content: This place is nasty and noisy. People tend to congregate outside in the "courtyard" all night and the rooms have no soundproofing so sleep is hard to come by. The room featured a nice bed but the bathtub finish was "flaking" and the tv was small and old. The casino is horribly smoky but adequate in size. The only redeeming feature of this place is the Denny's inside which had great and affordable food and friendly service. They also tack on an extra fee of $4.95 for god knows what (a common thing in Las Vegas now); nicer places can be found at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for budget trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pete W
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference based at a hotel at the south end of the Strip - for 6 days - and this place was the perfect base. It was just a ten minute brisk walk to the Strip every morning. The location is great. The hotel is nothing fancy - but it was clean, pleasant and had everything I needed. The staff were invariably pleasant and friendly, making me feel welcome. Breakfast was served by the charming folk at Dennys - the in-house eating place (thank you Iris). I was made to feel very welcome - there's a personal touch which I suspect may lack in some of the bigger, flashier hotels. Yes, there was sometimes a bit of noise late at night - the rooms are not soundproofed as well as they might be, but come on, this is Vegas, and at the price, you're not paying for complete perfection. Don't expect grandeur or luxury, but do expect a friendly, clean, convenient base for a trip to Vegas, and this place won't disappoint you.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Gene A
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay. Dave at the check in was very helpful and knowledgeable. That's the way to avoid long lines. The car parked close to the room beats the long walks to the parking garage in the major casinos..We'll do it again.

Reviews.Title: “A Genuine economical Oasis for the my frequent visits to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jeff b
Reviews.Content: My company is based in Palm Springs but more than half of our work is in Las Vegas. We have been booking rooms here almost every week for many years. The rooms are clean, the rates are affordable, parking is ample and secure but the staff here at Days Inn is what keeps us coming back. My two favorite receptionists Rachel and Bobby along with the entire front desk crew are like a welcome wagon of warmth, smiles and subtile exchanges that make being away from home not like being away from home. Jeff Brooker Courtmaster Sports, Inc.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I could ask for”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVanMetre
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here once before, several years ago, before Days Inn took over the Wild Wild West. Then it was a tad rundown, but still decent. Now, it is SO much better! The bed was so incredibly comfortable, and the tub was as well. We had a room that faced the pool. It was pretty quiet, except for the occasional door closing or voices as people walk by the room. It is in the perfect location - just off the strip, and not far from basic services you may need. Wells Fargo, Bank of America, Albertsons, and everything else you could need are all conveniently located just down Tropicana a couple of blocks. Also, the desk staff is excellent. They are courteous, friendly, and knowledgeable. The free Denny's breakfast is a great perk to staying here. For every person every day of your stay they give you vouchers for a free grand slam and a free cup of coffee. We really enjoyed not having to figure out where to have breakfast every day. Parking is easy to navigate as well. No problem with anythign during our stay, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Budget Accommodation, 5 mins from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneWA84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 12th-19th January, while visiting vegas for a friend's wedding. I was a bit weiry at first as it was off the strip and me being a first time visiter to the states, never mind to sin city. I decided to book anyway and got a deluxe room for $390 inlcuding taxes and a $4.95 daily service fee (for use of the pool,Jacuzzi,Free Coffee,Free Wifi and local calls) which i think was ok considering some 3star hotels in vegas charge $20 per day! The reception staff were really friendly and helpful, The room was a little dated but clean and roomy even with the 2 queen beds! TV was something out of the dark ages and kept turning itself off but, There was 16 cable channels to choose from and its not like your in the hotel very often to watch it anyway. Possibly why they haven't been exchanged for flat screens? It can get quite noisy at night around the smoking rooms block, as it is situated next to the wild wild west truck stop. and its close to the freeway, but i didnt have any problems getting to sleep. Breakfast was included in the room rate, and was provided by dennys restaurant located in the back of the casino. You get three choices for breakfast from the 'value menu up to $4' choice of grand slam, cheese omlette or oatmeal..No modifcations can be made so after a few days i got bored. Kinda silly as there was cheaper treats on the breakfast menu like the blueberry pancake puppies with cream cheese frosting for $2..But they wouldnt let you switch. Waitresses always extremley hypo and happy especially the bubbly mexican/spanish lady who's name i cant remember but she always brightened up my morning with her dulcit tones 'muchos gracias senorita' The casino is small but unique, apparently dubbed ' the best little locals casino in vegas' they have 50c roulette and happy hour with $2 draughts and $2 shots 3pm-7pm and 11pm-3am. Cocktail waitresses don't frequent the penny slots very often so you have to try and follow her around a little, or wait a while to get your 'free' or $1 drinks. But once you tip them, they do start to come round a little more often. Bus stops are located right outside the hotel and you can walk along the busy intersection over the freeway if your feeling brave enough itll take you about 15 mins, there is a sidewalk but its still a bit tricky as cars still carry on driving even when the walk signs are on! but it's easy to catch the bus and the strip is only one stop away. I think overall this hotel is great for the price and i was more than happy with the service i received whilst staying here. The only issue i have is that, upon check in i was advised that there was a $25 a day security deposit to be taken from my card, I was not made aware of this. There was nothing advised at the time of booking nor was there anything mentioned in the booking terms and conditions, So i hadn't factored this into my hotel cost. I explained that i didnt have enough money for this so the receptionist took $50 cash deposit. I this obviously ate into my budget too. Of course i got it back on check out. But who needs it on the day they're going home?? I think that this needs to be displayed on their terms of booking, as people may end up getting ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service At Days Inn Wild, Wild West”
Reviews.Author: Francisco S
Reviews.Content: I travel on business to Vegas quite frequently & when I do I make it a point to stay at the Days Inn on Tropicana Dr. Robert Ruiz's Staff are a top-notch Team when it comes to making me feel welcome. They ensured that I got a room which is historically quiet during the day. Since I work nights, this was very important to me. And the King size bed is very comfy. Miss Rachel ensured that I got my complimentary meals and coffee & confirmed daily that my room was serviced AFTER I was up and about on MY schedule. No sleep interruptions here! My favorite eatery is Denny's. And there's one right on the premises! Overall, my stay here was Awesome and I look forward to returning in the near future!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: hearthis09
Reviews.Content: cheapest rate i could find in las vegas during the convention time, room was clean except for some hairs on the sink, and soiled paper doily on sink. heater worked good but not automatic, only on and off and 2 settings. walls were alittle thin, could hear shower, walking, talking, doors closing, etc, normal for hotels but seemed alittle louder than normal, did not keep me awake though. got changed from my first room given due to air conditioning unit outside the door. free breakfast and coffee at dennys was good, service was good. you have a choice of 3 meals. i did not see any shady people around and they do have security guards. I did not see any bed bugs. mattress is new simons beauty rest and was comfortable. I drove my car so walking was not a problem for me. TV worked ok and does turn on at full volume for some reason. not a big deal just turn it down quickly. $4.95 daily service charge is applied to your stay. alarm clock worked after resetting the time on it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean and Close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: aido29
Reviews.Content: This place offers a very cheap stay just a 10 minute walk from the strip. Situated beside several well known fast food joints behind the New York New York hotel. We got fantastic value with a small friendly casino, outdoor swimming pool, free breakfast and a nice clean room with air conditioning for half nothing. The casino offers low min bet tables of roulette, black jack and craps and the dealers are always willing to lend a helping hand. Drinks are very cheap in the bar and Dennys is also connected to the casino and stay open very late :) Taxis to old town vegas cost approximately $20 and about 8$ to the strip if your too tired to walk or its to hot out. If your looking to save your money for the fun times on your trip and not fork out several hundred dollars on the huge hotels on the strip, this is absolutely perfect. Good food all around you, nice quaint casino, cheap drink, swimming pool, air-conditioned clean rooms and off the hustle of the strip but close enough to enjoy it. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Wild West The Best”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: I have to say I love the Wild Wild West. I've been staying there for over 7 years and it always feels like coming home. Over the last few years it's been about 10 days a month I stay and play there. The Front Desk Staff all know me by name and always go out of their way to make me feel like a high roller. I would like to give a special thanks to Issac, and Bobby during the day and when I arrive at 3am after driving from Tucson it's a pleasure to see David, Suzie, and Hung at night. These folks always smile! I visit Vegas because my clients rent our promotional slot machines for their trade show booths. When I get a job,the first place I think of is Wild Wild West. The Spa is always hot and really nice, and you can't beat FREE breakfast at Denny's in the morning.. It's a motor lodge style hotel with easy access to all of Las Vegas. You can just park in front of your room. You don't have to walk for 30 min to get to your room like strip hotels. Bellagio it's not, neither is the price! The maids always have the rooms clean ,and greet you with a smile. The folks at the Wild Wild West know it's good to have a job these days, so when I get a job in Las Vegas it's my first choice!. P.S. I get comp and low price rooms at strip hotels, but if you have a car, the convinience and awesome location make the the Days Inn at the Wild Wild West - THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “las vegas”
Reviews.Author: bashiri
Reviews.Content: stayed there at the wild wild west during the past holiday and had a nice time. the rates were great, rooms were clean, and the staff was great. Bobby, Rachel, and Isac were especially helpful with room changes, room servicing, tips on places to go, explaining charges you name it. they were a big help and are truly appreciated. I'll make it a point to stay there nxt time because of that, the price and convience to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “firstimer”
Reviews.Author: univ of u
Reviews.Content: It is one of the good places to stay inexpensive ,clean ,courteous and professional staff,safe and security watching over the property 24 hrs. To top it all they all so give you complimentry breakfast coupons for the number of days you stay there and if you don't want to wait to be seated they do take outs also.It is away from the downtown by about 4 minutes with lot of parking space. Overall very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Excalibur end of the Strip in Vegas!!! With Walk”
Reviews.Author: boat33
Reviews.Content: I had Convention at Mandalay Bay on Strip( were the cost of rooms are expensive) We lack of coffee at convention, It must cost to much at Mandalay Bay and Stayed her and saved big Bucks!!! and it was Very good. The hotel has Nice rooms modern, with outside corridors with Free Denny's Breakfast with Free Coffee, The staff at Denny's are Great!!!, Wyndham Group own Days Inn..It does have small casino were they smoke.. Please be aware you have walk about 20 mins to the strip across the bridge, I did every day for 5 days, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience for the price”
Reviews.Author: bigcee2000
Reviews.Content: Front desk was very professional. Received three complimentary breakfast at dennys for the three day stay with my girlfriend .the place was kept clean and room service was quick. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: dannyandsue
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful stay. No problems. Pool area and jacuzzi were lovely and breakfast was good each morning.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: Janet L
Reviews.Content: I suggest do research on Vegas neighborhoods. This one was scary, drug dealers out front, noisy traffic, drunk people in the middle of the night passing the room. The room itself was way too small. The guy next door was out all night leaving his tv on, brought a girl back in the middle of the night and had a good (Im sure pay) session of moaning and groaning. It was so noisy that I turned on the fan which blew out dust and gave me a huge bronchitis attack. The bathroom was filthy, and after a long drive, just wanted a hot bath. No way. My partner would not even use the shower. The beds were clean and acceptable and the service was good when we decided to just pack it up in the morning. They refunded the next day.

Reviews.Title: “..would have ruined our experience in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MontanaMountainMan
Reviews.Content: 11/21/11 me and my family decided to buy tickets here because of the extremely low rates and false advertising (i don't have time to post any examples but if you don't believe me go and see the hotel for yourself, its a [...] hole.) when we got there we discovered it was the opposite of what we expected... before we even got through the front door we witnessed prostitution and a drug deal those involved didn't seem to be intimidated by the abundant amount of security there... the surrounding area was littered with trash and debree and looked more like a ghetto then a hotel... when we walked in it smelled like cigarettes the place was radiating with negative energy, the minute we walked in we called a friend and didn't even bother to check in... we managed avoid the worst and get a discounted room in Excalibur and although 300$ down the drain we had a great time in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal going”
Reviews.Author: brendajok
Reviews.Content: Luxury is the word for being comfortable. Beds and hot water supply fall into the luxury category. Pool area nice but pool very cold now. Hot tub wonderful. Told at check-in it was 24 hrs. but unable to get in late. Didn't push it. Nice reasonable laundry room. Denny's grand slam every day (make sure you get the free coffee cards, too, at desk) and oatmeal and wheat pancakes are choices. For .49 you can have fresh fruit, yogurt, or ham as choices Free wifi. We bought juice at a grocery and kept on ice to save $5.00 per day. Slot machines - take with a grain of salt. Need to try tables as they look bored. 1/2 price appetizers, $ drafts & margaritas at certain times every day. TV on maximum volume every time we turned it on. Weird. Lots of parking. 15 minute walk to strip if desired.

Reviews.Title: “Was a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Ely F
Reviews.Content: Rooms and toilet were clean, receptionist was nice, complimentay food was good. No problem with parking. Close to the Vegas Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to do VEGAS on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Samantha M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, i was dubious at the thought of staying here as we got it for such a great rate and the reviews on here put it down. When we got there it is about a 5 minute walk away from the strip and easily accessible. The pool area is good! Bed is really comfortable and place is clean! We are backpacking the world and were really happy with the hotel for the price we paid - make sure you book in advance as paying when you get there they hike up the price! This was the case for a couple before us in the queue!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a Motel”
Reviews.Author: Edgar M
Reviews.Content: as this was the first time i was staying off the strip due to low budget issues i chose to stay at the days inn....i read some of the reviews from previous guest and it made me really concerned as to what i was getting my self into since i had already booked everything thru bookit.com so i proceeded to email the property manager and let him know about my concerns he was very prompt about responding back to my email that made me feel better about my arrivel to the hotel upon arrival the front desk staff was friendly and fun....went to my room checked everything to see if bedding was free off bed bugs as that was one of my concerns glad to see it was clean and very comfortable,the bathroom was a bit outdated bathtub seemed used and dirty but i guess there cracked and old that was the only issue.the room came with free breakfest from dennys that was very helpful as i was on a slight budget the coffee wasent really great at all but you can always go out to a starbucks or something (lol), walking to the strip is a bit scary as everyone has said in there postings but you can take an $8 taxi cab ride to the palms and rio i love the palms specialy there slot machines lol i did win good money there but lost it when i went to the bathroom and came back to keep playing word of advice dont go pee when your on a winning streak lol u'll lose your luck,check out time was a little bit annoying as they only have two computers and it seems as if they forget your standing there but its ok you just have to be a bit patient.i would stay there agian with out a problem hopeing to get the same experience

Reviews.Title: “NICE VALUE,WITH EXTRAS”
Reviews.Author: saulele
Reviews.Content: Expect what you would expect from a MOTEL! Values included a breakfast and coffee coupon used at the onsite Dennys!Nice POOL! onsite Casino is small but comfy,nice SPORTS BAR. lots of TVs,great $1 drink happy hours! Had a double room,bathroom is small but usable,TV is CRT type with limited channels,internet is free and fast!Room was clean but not cleaned one day on weekend! Was given a first floor room althought requested a second floor room,footstep noise from second floor room could be heard!Ice machine was far from room,need your room key. Althought a wyndham member,could not check in early!\

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: writer11
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 3 nights. We weren't sure what to expect when we got here because the price was so much lower than the places on the Strip. I can't say enough about how great it was in so many ways. First of all, it was a short 3 minute drive to the main part of the Strip. Don't try walking unless you're very brave because you have to cross busy roads - other than that the neighborhood is safe. Secondly, the staff was exremely helpful. friendly & knowledgeable. Third, there's a 24 hour Denny's on site with delicious & reasonably priced food. Fourth, the beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel, including a 4 star hotel in Paris. There's a gift shop on site and of course a casino. You get the usual free drinks while you're gambling. There's an outdoor pool and hot tub. No fitness center. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean but not for Vegas first-timers”
Reviews.Author: grevo77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights. The hotel is conveniently located close to i-15. This is a plus since you dont need to drive much on the busy Vegas streets. Its enough far from the airport so no airplane noise. From outside it looks like a dump. From inside its better. The rooms are very clean but they are small and outdated. Unfortunately, my room was on the first floor and I could hear footsteps from the top. Stay on the second floor. Internet was free but you have to request an account from the front desk. They will not give it to you if you don't ask. Although breakfast is free in the nearby Denny's the choices are limited and no coffee or juice is included (you have to pay...). Hey Days inn what it the meaning of the free breakfast then? Although it takes 10-15 min to go to NY NY you have to cross busy intersections and pass through some dark and scary spots. Nothing happened to me but be careful. The hotel charges a ~$5 resort fee for nothing. I believe that this fee makes the customer more angry than the hotel rich. I cannot say much about the casino because I haven't played but the game delivered a sad feeling to me. In conclusion, this hotel offers clean and very cheap rooms. That is definitely very good. The building, the rooms and the casino are not attractive. So if you are visiting Vegas for the first time pay $20 more and stay somewhere else. If you are an experienced Vegas traveler and you need a clean room for bed and shower, this place is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: p d
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and it was inside the casino. I paid $72.17 for a weekend night through hotwire. My room was 703, I parked my car right in front and noticed a dirty t-shirt on the floor in front of our door. My sister didn't want to touch it so she kicked it away from the door. All of a sudden a women (with no teeth and only about 26 years old) ran down from the upper level screaming, "That's my t-shirt". My sister apologized but the woman was crazed about the dirty shirt. That incident was frightening. The room was filthy, my family and I did not take off our shoes and placed our bags on a high clothes rack (for fear of vermin/bugs). Do not stay on the ground floor unless you like GIANT cockroaches. The door to the room is about an inch from the floor so cockroaches have easy access. For the short duration we stayed (2 hours) we killed 3 huge cockroaches that just wandered in from under the door. The sheets on the bed were wet! There was a gunshot hole in the ceiling! We also heard our upstairs neighbors fighting and what sounded like wrestling above our heads. The rug was filthy...do not remove your shoes or the soles of your feet will be black. The room was extremely small and the bathroom is a closet. DO NOT STAY here! We also then noticed that this hotel was more of a low budget apartment complex. We checked in and we checked out! There are prostitutes and pimps outside the hotel. There is a Wendy's across the street and my family and I ( I had children with me) saw a Pimp discipline his "worker". The entire area (even though it is close to the airport and Vegas strip) is very seedy. The casino is extremely small and OLD! The slot machine images were faded and there was not a good selection of gambling options. I have stayed in hotels/motels before but I was scared for my safety in this place. We checked in and we checked out! They did not issue a refund because it was booked through hotwire. ..BUT they made sure to charge us an additional $5.50 for a hotel service fee. I asked what is this fee for and they said "security" . I didn't even argue, I just wanted to get out of there. I will be writing a letter to hotwire for recommending such a cesspool. I never write reviews but I thought it was important to warn others of this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Excellent customer service. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: phillyrican
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay there for my first time ever in Vegas, because of the great rates. At first I didn't expect much, do to the fact that I got a cheap deal. So when I arrived and saw the, outdated, "motelish" facade, I thought, oh well, I will get what I paid for; but fortunately I was wrong. Upon checking-in I was greeted by a very friendly and professional clerk (I was so impressed by her outstanding customer service, that I even took the time to read her name tag; her name is Sussie) She made me feel welcome and answered all my questions with a smile on her face. Then I tought, probably she's the exception, but I was wrong again!!! All the staff of the hotel that I interacted with during my stay there (11 nights) were very friendly, courteous, and helpful. The room assigned to me was clean and comfortable. It included free internet. The only drawback was that there were not enough electrical outlets for all my stuff. But no big deal; I just resorted to unplugging the floor lamp, and plugging in the charger to my handycam, hehehe. The hotel contained a swimming pool large enough for me to swim in. I really enjoyed the fact that it was not crowded the times I used it. In fact, many times I had the whole swimming pool to myself. I used to pick up my free breakfast (included) at Denny's (located inside the hotel) and take it to the pool area to eat it there. Oh,and there was also a hot tub by the pool. The next day I went to the small casino to play. It is located next to the check-in area. It has 2 blackjack tables (my game) with minimum $5 bets, a roulette table, and a relatively good number of slot machines. The dealers were very friendly, however some looked depressed due to the fact that there were not too many gamblers on their tables--and thus not too many tips to complement their incomes. It's a shame, because they are really good people. They take their time to learn your name and get to know you better in a personal level. And you get the feeling that they are really rooting for you. After that I decided to hit the Strip, and that's when I formed the only negative opinion about my stay there. Even though the hotel is relatively close to the Strip, I will not recommend for you to walk there. It is a dangerous walk. And I am not refering to crime, I'm talking about traffic. You will be force to cross some very busy avenues, and even highways, where cars seem to be going 60 and 70 mphs. And the fact that there are pedestrian crossing lights on every intersection will not ease your apprehention. So if you're staying there, consider taking a cab or renting a car to move around (which will add to your expense). I ended up doing neither. I walked to the Strip--and back to the hotel--all the time during my stay there. I did it under 108 degrees heat during the day, and deserted sidewalks during the late nights. I looked at it as my daily exersice routine.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NOT STAY ANYWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: anthony63ca
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at the Westward Ho on the strip and were very disappointed when they tore it down..have stayed at many of the BIG name hotels but finally found Wild Wild West and it is so much like Westward Ho..small personal and not so big that you get lost in the crowd..rooms are really not bad, the only thing the BIG name hotels have is a bigger price tag...we love the casino small and friendly and you can actually win there....we have a time share and actually prefer to stay here....we visit family and friends while we are here ....will will continue to stay at WILD WILD WEST and continue to recommend it to others..THANK YOU WILD WILD WEST FOR MAINTAINING THE OLD VEGAS FEELING LOVE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay, though we were hesitant at first”
Reviews.Author: Mod P
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this place on a package deal from some vegas website. I was a bit hesitant, because I am deathly afraid of parasites, and I had read the old review on a beg bug alert on this place. So, I had to contact management and ask if things had been cleaned up. I realize that some of the most expensive hotels on the strip have had issues with the critters, so it really doesn't matter where you stay. As a traveler, be smart and do your homework. Robert Ruiz, the hotel manager, promptly responded to my inquiries, and let me know that they had cleaned the place up and installed new mattresses and bedding. He also told me that they hadn't had any complaints since. So, we decided to stay. For the price and the level of accommodations, we couldn't complain. It's definitely and older motel, but it was clean, and we had no problems with pests. A simple room for a decent price. Sometimes, that's all you need. We didn't have any problems with noisy visitors, and we felt safe. So, we couldn't ask for anything more. They are pet friendly, too. And, that's really hard to find. Thanks Days Inn!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here because it was cheap; we got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: charitytraveler
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we just needed to stay one night in Vegas, near the airport (6 am flight). We didn't want to spend a lot of money, and this was a good price. Seriously, though, I was concerned for my safety here. I didn't feel safe walking by myself to our room. The check-in line was slow, and it's right in the gambling hall, which was filled with cigarette smoke. The hotel room, although a little cramped, was pretty comfortable (and no bed bugs, I checked!), but I don't think that the bathroom had been cleaned before we arrived (we had new towels, but there were used ones on the floor and the bathtub looked rather suspicious). We did swim at the pool, which was nice, and the Denny's attached to the hotel was good (which I'm not usually a fan of Denny's). But next time, I think we won't be so frugal in our pick.

Reviews.Title: “Such an amazing time! Will be staying there again!”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I, along with a few of our friends, visited Las Vegas between July 6th and July 10th, staying at the Wild Wild West. We had previously stayed at your hotel during a trip last year, and enjoyed the stay so much we chose to stay there again. Having stayed at the “bigger” name hotels on prior trips, it was quite a different experience to stay at your hotel. I found the level of personal attention was very refreshing. The dealers at the tables were very personable, and actually took the time to talk and get to know you, and were always extremely friendly. We spent a lot of time in the casino during the third shift, which is the swing shift, and interacting the pit boss, Jason, was always a high note of the experience. Not only was he very attentive to our group, but also to the other players at other tables. He was very pleasant to be around, as well as the dealers, making the entire time we spent there a very memorable experience. Everybody we encountered during our stay was very pleasant, from the front desk clerks, to the bar staff, to the housekeepers. I can honestly say that I have absolutely nothing negative to say. When talking to other people about our trip, I cannot stop emphasizing what a great time we had at your hotel, and I find myself constantly recommending people that they should stay there instead of anywhere else. For all of our future trips to Las Vegas, we will be staying at the Wild Wild West, and look forward to hopefully seeing some familiar faces that made our recent stay so pleasant and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Fun casino and free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Vibratone
Reviews.Content: The rooms are your basic motel room. It has a small but nice pool. The area is a little dodgey as the need 24 hr security to patrol the grounds. I did feel safer knowing those guys were out there because, even though only a couple of blocks off the strip the local clientele are a bit scary! In think this is a good value motel but don't expect the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “loved and would not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: eliinbalt
Reviews.Content: perfect in every way. loved the room and the location of the hotel. pool , service, restaurant all great. thank you !

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for weekends - close to Strip”
Reviews.Author: maboscel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to beat the escalated weekend prices the casinos charge. Here, it was in the $30 range on the weekend for three nights and included a Denny's b'fast for each of us. We found the room was dated, but bedding was like new - excellent sleep. Carpet was such that I'd wear shoes. Room was small - but typical of a Days Inn. The pool was really nice. We enjoyed being out there - they provided towels and nice chairs and nice atmosphere. Having the b'fast at Denny's was great - you didn't have to worry about feeding yourself in the morning. Also, they had free WIFI. They DO have a $5 resort fee on top of your rate, so beware of that. Overall, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good”
Reviews.Author: Realitytv
Reviews.Content: Ok they are trucks nearby, never heard a thing, the plce is clean , the pool is well maintained, the staff are friendly , they give you a free breakfast at the dennys, (staff not so friendly there) Theres free internet, there is a resort fee, ill never stay at resort fee but this is the only one worth it. Whoever the manager is deserves a raise, big time, is not the strip, but its really amazing value. Security was present never saw trouble. They do there best with an old property. Bed was comfortable. Dont waste money on others this was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all.”
Reviews.Author: Jocko49
Reviews.Content: We stayed in may of 2010 an we stayed 4 days. The staff was VERY freindly and the casino staff was AWSOME. We would stay again.I'm not sure what people are saying about the nights being kinda rough.It was'nt bad at all. The veiw of the strip is nice at night. The pool area was as clean as any other hotel.Come on you people who are complaining about this place.Its sounds to me nothing would have been good enough for you. Go to the strip and pay $200. bucks and stop complaining, We had a great time there !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent buy for your money”
Reviews.Author: Hiroads2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days in April. The rooms have recently been remodelled with new beds and nice new linens. The room and bathroom were clean and comfortable. Could not beat the price of $21 a night and that included a free Grand Slam breakfast at Denny's on site (may only be for weekdays) There is an In N Out burger across the street. This place is in walking distance to the strip or easy cab ride. Also I appreciated the 24 hour onsite security because you enter the rooms from outside. But the area was safe regardless. But they kept the late night parties down. Pool was clean and enjoyable. We have tried some other budget hotel options during expensive high season times in LV and have not been pleased. But would defianetly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “It was definitely a great place to stay all round!!”
Reviews.Author: Gilbob88
Reviews.Content: It's only 10 minutes max to the strip, casino is grand all tables low minimums compared to strip, great happy hour twice a day, bedrooms are very nice especially for the cheap prices, plus so comfy it's so hard to get out lol, lovely pool area and also friendly staff, we've already booked to go back in June :)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - close to the strip. Been twice, will go again”
Reviews.Author: livesinnasuitcase
Reviews.Content: To be honest, the first time I stayed at the WWW, I got a pretty hefty culture shock! My husband was staying at the MGM for a conference and we decided I'd join him at the end, stay a couple of nights in Vegas, then onto a road trip (different story). So having seen the MGM and one of the other grand hotels on the strip, my heart sank when we pulled into the car park at the WWW... However first impressions aren't always what they're cracked up to be! To be fair, if you have a room facing the main road or the truck car park you can expect a little background noise during the night and early morning. However the rooms were fairly clean, working showers (even had soap etc!) a comfy bed and air con, which is pretty much all you need. The staff at the casino were absolutely amazing! Incredibly friendly, helpful, patient and a sense of humour you would not see anywhere on the strip! We've stayed at the WWW on 2 occasions now, I'd reccommend it to anyone who would like to experience Vegas without breaking their bank account. One last very positive thing: if you're into your gambling, this is def the place to do it! The dealers are so helpful and the minimum bet stays at 5 bucks all day! Unlike the other fancy places where minimum bets go from $5 at breakfast to $10 at lunch to $15 for afternoon coffee and $20 in the evening...

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to crash and keep your bags”
Reviews.Author: whereisnext
Reviews.Content: We booked rooms in this place because it was $20 a night and somewhat close to the strip and we weren't disappointed. First of all this is what i'd call 'cheap and cheerful.' The people who work here are great and it doesn't have that seedy feel that other cheap hotels in the area do. The rooms are unimpressive (what do you expect for $20?) but they are clean and have the basics. There's also a pool but none of us dared to venture in. As with pretty much every other hotel in Vegas there is an accompanying casino which is small but has all the games and can usually be more fun that the bigger casinos as it's more laid back and less crowded. Finally it's about a 5 minute walk to the strip and there's an In-and-Out burger place across the road. What else could you need for $20!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, overlooked no bedbugs for us?”
Reviews.Author: PhillTravelMonkey
Reviews.Content: Review: Wild Wild West, Las Vegas General/Positives • The reception is situated in the casino lounge. • The bedroom doors have good electric swipe card locks. • Rooms have a great mattress and quite bed. Noise level are very quiet. • The bath include a shower and you feel like you are in a clean good standard hotel. Negatives • The location of the Travelodge isn’t great for San Francisco as its a good 35 minute to the main strip. • The casino lounge unfortunately have cigarette smoke everywhere throughout all Vegas casinos. • Expensive internet facility’s. Outcome: • Parking : available • Internet: yes Pc facility’s, yes WiFi • Linen: yes very clean. • Reception: Staff were very helpful and friendly . • Local transport :Buses or outside cabs • Weather: December was mild and the desert has great evening sky’s. Score • 8/10 Great stay. • Just off the strip. Defiantly stay here again on my second visit. • $23.00 per night for 2 people include tax complete bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: XxHollyxX
Reviews.Content: I was planning on staying here for 2 nights back in July 2010. I have never had such a horrible hotel experience. I wasnt expecting anything nice for the price I paid but $30 a night was a rip off. The location itself is not the greatest and kind of scary at night First, the tv didn't work, I called the front desk anew they sent someone out immediately. Second, after coming back from the strip, I'm getting ready to go to bed when I pull back the covers and there was several bed bugs just crawling. And there were also bugs flying around the room. I called the front desk to complain about the infestation and they apologized and offered to move me to another room...as it was 3 am I refused and I was kind of scared of what I may find in other rooms. I decided to leave that night since I was not going to sleep in that room..so I cancelled my second night stay...they were hesitant to give me my second night deposit back but after to the manager, my money was refunded but unfortunately not my first nigt stay in which I hardly used the room. I checked into the MGM at 4 am. I guess I've learned my lesson for staying somewhere cheap, sometimes paying extra is worth it. I do not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Go Local”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Weston
Reviews.Content: This review relates only to the casino, not the rooms. My husband and I were put up in the Hampton Inn across the road when a delayed flight kept us in Vegas an extra night. The Hampton Inn doesn't have a casino, we didn't have a car and my husband didn't want to go far, so our options for entertainment were severely limited. We saw the sign for the Wild West Casino and walked over. The casino is very small and dark with a (very) few tables and a small number of machines. We loved it. Really. Why? First, at the bar, I got a large premium draft for $2 (actually, at that price, I got more than one). The machines were (relatively new), the same ones we saw on the Strip. Unlike the Strip, we got great play out of them. Playing the penny machines, we ended up $40.00 that evening, and went down $20.00 the next morning, but we had fun playing for a good amount of time. It's clearly a locals bar: we were too shy to play Blackjack because everyone playing seemed to know one another, but we did not at all feel out of place or unwelcome. The casino reminded me of those you find in small towns throughout the state, like Beatty or Mesquite. Bottom line: it's similar to the casino at the Sahara, though smaller, with a better selection of really cheap, good draft beer, and you can play longer on the same amount of money. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll walk back for an afternoon there.

Reviews.Title: “Like a motel - rated far too highly on TripAdvisor!”
Reviews.Author: Jossters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as it was Labour Day weekend in the US and we couldn't get anywhere else. It was cheap so we weren't expecting anything special but we were also not expecting a room like the one in the film Vacancy (only smaller!). The guys in the casino looked as though they had never seen a woman before and overall it was a pretty bizarre experience. The room was ok - it was clean and there was a big bed in it. Other than that though, it was just like a motel and we didn't feel very safe at all. I had to get pretty drunk in order to go back there after a night out! I would only recommend this place for a bunch of guys on a stag do looking for somewhere cheap where they would spend no time. Definitely not one for couples!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: bulldog_lover86
Reviews.Content: We spent a week camping in california prior to checking in so staying here was like luxury heaven! Check-in was smooth and actcomadating. Our room was clean, comfortable king sized bed and had a real bathroom so we were happy! Spent the afternoon by the pool which was refreshing in the hot sun. Happy hour specials were great as well!! Location was right off the strip so a short, cheap cab ride to the places we went to. Also easy access on and off the freeway as we were driving through. Ate at Denny's in the hotel in the morning but wasn't all that great, typical Denny's. All in all was a great deal for what we got and we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bonnieconto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn Wild Wild West for 3 nights over the weekend. It cost us $30 per night over the weekend which quite honestly just can't be beat in Vegas. The rooms were clean and tidy, everything was in working order and the beds were the most comfortable we had slept in over our 4 week stay in the USA. The check in was quick and easy and staff helpful. The housekeeping staff were mostly not interested but hey who can blame them? Having the Denny's attached was great, cheap eats and during the happy hours (3pm - 7pm and 11pm - 3am) you get 1/2 price appetizers. The pool was clean and we never had a problem getting a lounger by the pool. Would I stay there again? Yes if was going to Vegas I would. It's great value and only a short walk straight behind New York, New York.

Reviews.Title: “Wild Wild West”
Reviews.Author: VitalijaB
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel to stay in for an reasonable price. IT was really nice that they have an outdoor pool. Not far away from the center, but with a rather long distance to Old Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk management during a time of recession.”
Reviews.Author: tracyja
Reviews.Content: There was a huge mix-up with a reservation. The front desk was unable to help with a refund or a transfer over to the following night. Understandably, it was the customers issue for accidentally scheduling the wrong dates but management should take into consideration other aspects. There is a recession going on and double charging a customer and not helping them out is not part of customer service in my book. Sorry Days Inn if you aren't able to refund us our money.........I will go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Casino”
Reviews.Author: Kansascloud
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at the attached Days Inn. I was at the Hampton Inn across the street but visited the Wild Wild West Casino every night of my stay. I liked it for some reason? For one thing, it is were the locals go. They all seem to know each other. It isn't a mega casino by any means. It is kind of a cozy little place. I guess the Wynn and the Bellagio just isn't my kind of place? When I'm in Las Vegas I crave the old time slightly cheezy places. Well noting screems CHEESE like a slightly smokey little casino attached to a Days Inn with a Denny's built right into it! Yes! My kind of place. Here is my tip. Set at the bar for at least a couple of drinks and make some new local friends. Pure entertainment in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for staying near the strip”
Reviews.Author: taniguck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must-stay for anyone on a budget. I managed to book a room for 2 people for 9 nights for only $420. Way cheaper than on the strip! Plus, the free wifi (as much as a $10/day value compared to hotels on the strip) brought the cost down even more. Although the room was a little in need of repair (toilet leaking, doorknob to bathroom loose), it was still a great value for the price paid. I felt safe in the room and was comfortable for the time I was there. Plus, now that the property is a Days Inn, you can expect a higher level of service and quality in the hotel rooms. The one downside to this hotel is the walk to the strip. It is relatively safe during the day but at night, it may be a bit creepy. I always walked with a friend just to be safe but after a week of doing it, I never met any shady characters. Bottom line, if price (and wifi cost) is an issue, book here!

Reviews.Title: “Probably will be better now as a Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: DudePassingThrough
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two years ago and it is cleaner now. It's been a Days Inn for about a month. The price is good. But there's still problems. Since it's a cheap place to stay a disproportionate number of people who stay here are people you wouldn't invite over for a Super Bowl party. Not everyone, but more than say the more expensive places. And the place is in need of repair. My door wouldn't close properly. Twice I set off a car alarm because I had to slam the door so hard to close it. And the latch you use to lock the door from the inside was missing, suggesting the door had been kicked in and they hadn't fixed it yet. Bottom line, though, was that it was clean and relatively quiet. I'd stay there again, especially since the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas on a budget? Book it.”
Reviews.Author: podla
Reviews.Content: Sounds a bit dodgy this place doesnt it? thats what i read and thats what we were told by a couple of taxi drivers so we were expecting a terrible experience. Dont get me wrong, its no Bellagio, the only fountain likely to go off every half hour here is the soda fountain in the connecting Dennys. But this place was fantastic for what we needed! super clean with free wireless internet, if it was hotter we would have used the pool but alas it is winter. The attached casino was a lovely place to gamble, we did see a couple of unsavoury characters but the security on the place were great and i felt very safe in the room too. The walk to the strip isn't much fun but there is a bus stop outside the hotel if you are really lazy (like me) This place is not a bad place, just really cheap if you book it through a hostel sight!

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Las Vegas At Wild Wild West Gambling Hall
HotelInfo.Address: 3330 W. Tropicana Ave., Las Vegas, NV 89103
